page.title: 04FUNDENHALL & SILFIELD
page.content: {A tiny part of Fundenhall}is in our area with arable fields,few houses & Fundenhall Wood with its deciduous trees.There are several pits,now water filled,dug by man for marl to enrich the land in days gone by.A Norwich/New Buckenham bus service runs on the one road in this part of Fundenhall. {This part of Silfield}is rural though administratively part of Wymondham Town called Cromwells Ward.It has sev_ eral arable farms,a few lanes & a B_ class main road with a Tues. & Fri. Wymondham/Mulbarton bus service.There is a primary school but other public buildings - The Compasses & Mariners pubs & the Methodist & Mission Chapels are long closed & in private occupa_ tion.Milk is delivered every other day & newspapers daily.Wymondham is the nearest centre for doctors, dentists & shops.
